channel.title: Peecs RSBot
channel.description:
[CENTER] [U][B]Peecs RSBot[/U] Welcome to the future of botting.
Want to bot more efficiently? Try Peecs modified RSBot over 1000 users already, with extra methods it's alot more efficient than the original RSBot. Along with additional scripts unavailable on the RSBot forums, come join our community and enjoy a better bot and better community.
Rsbot.info is where you want to be when you bot on RS. Why? Simply because its a great community where people are treated equally with updated scripts and a faster running bot, which Has amazingly new scripts and an easier way to access our scripts. Our community led by Peec, RubiTT, Phil and a few others, is updated regulary with new ways to please you, including The sleekest forum skins, and now vBULLETIN 3.8 with the best addons. There really is no point in continuosly saying how we conquer the other opponents with our private server aswell. Did I mention we Also now have the safest black market led by Phil And Grand, well we do. Although scamming is always possible we are tight on our security, and if shit happens and you're scammed, I will personally come and clear things up.
[url=http://google.com/]http://google.com/[/url] [url=http://"http://google.com"][IMG]http://i239.photobucket.com/albums/ff261/nikedude202/PRSB-1.jpg[/img][/url][/CENTER]

No matter, I’m done here. Thanks for the intelligent responses (sarcasm removed for qauters and cooper).

item.title: Peecs RSBot
item.dc:creator: @zzSLeepzz zzSLeepzz
item.description:
@zzSLeepzz wrote:

I think the bot is shit remark was aimed specifically at PeecsRSBot and not necessarily RSBot on which it is based. It only demonstrates the general ignorance of that person who posted that totally useless comment.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 19, 2009, 06:16:38 am[/size][hr][quote=“qauters, post:31, topic:268129”][quote author=zzSLeepzz link=topic=353909.msg2712449#msg2712449 date=1237408091]
Mods and admins whine and complain about leechers and when people come along (yes, just like me) that attempt to make an honest effort, they get snubbed. “We need more randomization!” Ha! As if that will throw Jagex off. Hyper-randomization is completely un-human-like. You want the bot to be detectable, it has to act just like a human. But noone cares to listen.
[/quote]
2 human actions can look like eachother but are never equal. Randomization is required to make it more human like.
People don’t follow the same path twice etc. If a bot acts like a human it’s not detectable…[/quote]
I mistyped my comment for this. When I said detectable, I meant UNdetectable. Sorry. You are absolutely right. My comment was directed at the general impression I get that most people seem to think more and more randomization is better. By that I mean more and more of the common antiban activities and more frequently. How man people constantly spin and adjust the camera and switch repeatedly between tabs? That’s what I’m referring to. Path walking and mouse movement must absolutely have randomization applied to each and every operation. I think we are in violent agreement on this one.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 19, 2009, 06:23:38 am[/size][hr][quote=“qauters, post:31, topic:268129”][quote author=zzSLeepzz link=topic=353909.msg2712168#msg2712168 date=1237397194]
b) After rsbot.org got nuked and rebuilt the second time, I cannot even obtain the courtesy of a reply to my request for reinstated VIP status. I was one of the first to donate for VIP when it was introduced on RSBot.org. Cowieseems unable to reply to me, other than on IRC where he offer nothing but puerile crap. [/quote] PM Speljohan, show him your reciept and you will get added. Many VIP's where restored, so there is no reason you wouldn't...[/quote] Unlike many people who frequent the forums, I tried to honor Spel's request to distribute the VIP requests among the other admins. I respected the demands on Spel's time and Cowie, completely disregarding my repeated attempts to contact him, completely ignores me. Granted, I am nothing special, but I never got rude or nasty about it either.

But you know, after seeing all this transpiring and what I’ve experienced over the past few months since I’ve starting using RSBot and tried to become more than just a leecher, I’m beginning to think that maybe it’s best if I just fade away. Stick to myself and do my own private thing, being grateful for what RSBot provides to build upon and just keep what I do to myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Peecs RSBot
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:9, topic:268129”][quote author=qauters link=topic=353909.msg2711946#msg2711946 date=1237376964]
If I see an other advertisement on MITB, I’ll change the license of rs.jar to not be allowed to use for forks.
Including built in protection, you are warned.
[/quote]hi jagex, nice of you to post here, owait[/quote]
I understand your sarcasm, it’s justified.
But that doesn’t hold me from protecting rs.jar from any other bot then the offical one.

zzSLeepzz:

a) I tried repeatedly and in vain to get RSBot to even CONSIDER enhancements after I spent hours and days and weeks learning the bot’s internals, writing/debugging scripts and trying to make them work as human-like as possible. I got nowhere.

Posts in the development section are reviewed. If people decide your good, you recieve svn access.
If you didn’t make it, then you probably weren’t good enough.
There are 9 people with svn access, so if you have good ideas at least one of them will cosider adding it.

zzSLeepzz:

b) After rsbot.org got nuked and rebuilt the second time, I cannot even obtain the courtesy of a reply to my request for reinstated VIP status. I was one of the first to donate for VIP when it was introduced on RSBot.org. Cowie` seems unable to reply to me, other than on IRC where he offer nothing but puerile crap.

PM Speljohan, show him your reciept and you will get added. Many VIP’s where restored, so there is no reason you wouldn’t…

zzSLeepzz:

So I’m on frustrated person who thought he found an outlet where he could actually participate in the development of the damn bot. After listening to all the ranting and raving about leechers, here comes someone who is programmer by profession and knows Java well.

As said before post ideas in the development section, or pm somebody with svn access (like me).

zzSLeepzz:

Granted, I agree that the advertisement was really unnecessary and over the top. It’s kinda like .org’s “marketing” of VIP status and the supposed VIP scripts that you gain access to. Those scripts aren’t really anything to write home about. The best scripts are the ones that are simply advertised to all for a fee.

It’s not like VIP, since that’s part of the site. Also VIP scripts are developed by VIP’s and still get leaked so they happen to be good enough.

zzSLeepzz:

The real root of the problem is the java code that surrounds rs.jar. It certainly can do with a great deal of improvement. Improvements geared toward making script writing less of an exercise in the minute details of randomization, mouse movements and clicking. Improvements to how randomization is done (flat distributions…give me a break). Improvements in detecting the cursor moving over the menu hotspot in a target tile. Improvements in continually varying mouse speed and reaction time rather than having a fixed one or one that is set only once when a script starts.

We have a development section for a reason.

zzSLeepzz:

Mods and admins whine and complain about leechers and when people come along (yes, just like me) that attempt to make an honest effort, they get snubbed. “We need more randomization!” Ha! As if that will throw Jagex off. Hyper-randomization is completely un-human-like. You want the bot to be detectable, it has to act just like a human. But noone cares to listen.

2 human actions can look like eachother but are never equal. Randomization is required to make it more human like.
People don’t follow the same path twice etc. If a bot acts like a human it’s not detectable…

zzSLeepzz:

Any effort that is going to improve on RSBot necessarily must be based on RSBot. It is an excellent base to start from because it is an excellent bot…but not excellent enough. But if the proprietors of the base aren’t interested in new contributors, what are we to do? Sure, maintain our own private version. But I want to share my particular efforts with others, and yes, even RSBot itself it they wanted.

We added people to the svn, because they made good improvements. We accept approvements, we review it we implement it. As long as you post in the development section, you don’t cry like a baby and be generally nice.

zzSLeepzz:

All of this division and personal attacking is a waste of energy and really unnecessary. It’s very unfortunate that it has come to this. I for one, LOVE the challenge of making a bot that Jagex can’t catch. That’s my goal. You guys want to have a pissing contest, have at it.

For somereason I create those things (QBot) and you only fantasize. Create one if you want…

frank_:

its a shit bot, who cares

It’s free and better then other bots arround.
Even shit can be good, if no better alternative.

Read full topic

item.title: Peecs RSBot
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“zzSLeepzz, post:26, topic:268129”]As for quality, I will grant that my tenure in RSBot-land is all of about 4 months. But I am not some 18 year old kid who learned Java on the internet either. I would suggest though, that before you make judgments on the quality of my code (I can only speak for me right now because I’m the only one actively working on it), you might look at some of it first. Is it less stable at the moment? Probably, but only because there aren’t as many developers to bounce ideas off of and to try ideas out. Being essentially shut out of (or more accurately, never given the chance of pitching in) the RSBot dev team, it’s just a fact of life.

But I do thank you for engaging in a conversation instead of lobbing useless puerile attacks. Kudos.[/quote]
You’re right, I should have looked at it before making judgments, and I’m sorry for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Peecs RSBot
item.dc:creator: @zzSLeepzz zzSLeepzz
item.description:
@zzSLeepzz wrote:

cooper:

You do realize that Pker has dug your “new fork” into a pit if quaters deems that advertising?

To be honest, it doesn’t much matter to me. I will continue with my own enhancements built on top of the RSBot base. It wouldn’t be for sale but I would make it available to anyone who would want it. I would not even bother with a website. It would just “be”.

cooper:

A lot of the “additions” have been taken from RSBot, so without access to their additions your project probably won’t be able to keep up. Even if your users stick to your bot, you probably won’t be able to match the quality.

Like I said before, I don’t agree with the marketing hype. Peec’s bot is RSBot+, plain and simple. What you call “additions” I call maintenance. Peec’s bot is and should continue to be based completely on RSBot, in my opinion. But if you look closely, you’ll notice things like my taking RSBot’s ideas for random number generation to the next level. All consistent with my personal goal to make the bot’s external behaviors indistinguishable from that of a human while at the same time trying to eliminate some of the stickiest scripting problems through more intelligent bot methods.

As for quality, I will grant that my tenure in RSBot-land is all of about 4 months. But I am not some 18 year old kid who learned Java on the internet either. I would suggest though, that before you make judgments on the quality of my code (I can only speak for me right now because I’m the only one actively working on it), you might look at some of it first. Is it less stable at the moment? Probably, but only because there aren’t as many developers to bounce ideas off of and to try ideas out. Being essentially shut out of (or more accurately, never given the chance of pitching in) the RSBot dev team, it’s just a fact of life.

You know what would be really ironic? If RSBot actually picked up some of the enhancements that were introduced into PRSB…like automatically downloading rs.jar when its out of date, or the application of Gaussian random number distributions (instead of the current flat distribution…yuck), or the incorporation of automatically varying the mouse speed as part of normal mouse movement (rather than pushing that as a fixed setting up to the scripter). There’s always hoping, but alas, pride and lust of power are difficult obstacles to overcome, especially for the younger among us.

But I do thank you for engaging in a conversation instead of lobbing useless puerile attacks. Kudos.

Read full topic

item.title: Peecs RSBot
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“zzSLeepzz, post:24, topic:268129”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=353909.msg2712585#msg2712585 date=1237413119]
Never miss a good chance to shut the fuck up.
[/quote]

Wow, and you are a moderator? I’m stuck in “Lord of the Flies” in real life. Lord have mercy…
Perhaps you should consider following your own sage advice.[/quote]
You do realize that Pker has dug your “new fork” into a pit if quaters deems that advertising?

18.March 2009

  • .org Updates:
    +rev 122 to Script.java
    +rev 123 Delete WorldMapCloser.java. Add CloseAllInterface.java

16/17.March 2009

Many many updates incorporated from RSBot.org

  • Added a bunch of new and as-yet untested mouse methods that support specifying
    the desired target action. When the mouse handler encounters the action, it
    stops the mousemovement a few randomized increments after first encountering it.
    THESE NEW METHODS HAVE NOT YET BEEN TESTED. Scripters use them at your own
    peril.

  • Tweeked bank support so it works better with the new .org updates.

  • Removed non-working or retired random scripts

  • Picked up .or updates to BeehiveSolver, EvilTwin (replaces Molly), FreakyForester
    Maze, Pillory, Pinball, WelcomeScreen

  • .org Updates

    • Backed out .or rev118 updates because they did.
    • rev119 partial - rs.jar and RSLoader.java, bot will work again with update.
    • rev117 update to BotGUI for hiding log pane of game client.
    • rev118 updates to Script.java and ScriptHandler.java to fix the thread.stop() method

  • Bank Class

    • Added zzSleepzz’s open method to support numerous banker NPCs, booths
      and chests. Use debug to provide IDs for new additions! Post them in the
      forum. A future enhancement will be to select the nearest NPC/booth in
      banks such as Varrock’s.
    • .org added many new banking hooks, so methods like Bank.getCount now work
      There is now a Bank.withdraw method too…trust me, it is very nice.
    • Added support for new bank interface and then picked up additional
      changes from .org, including Constants definitions in order to be compatible
      with .org’s bot.

  • InputHandler/MouseHandler
    ++ Late fix for divide by zero exceptions that occur occasionally during
    mouse operations.

    • Changed the InputHandler and MouseHandler classes so they vary the mouse
      speed with each operation.
    • Modifications to support deprecating the unnecessary mouse methods in
      the Methods class.
    • New random number generation, refer to Methods class info.

  • Methods class

    • Deprecated the more useless mouse methods, directing scripters to use
      the InputHandler instance directly (e.g. input.moveMouse(speed, x, y, rx, ry))
    • Change random number generation based on an idea from random number
      generation updates from .org. We use a Guassian distribution instead of
      the standard flat distribution everyone else uses.
    • Changed the Methods.atNPC method to use Ruski’s method (with his permission)
    • Changed doWalk() to click on screen if target tile is on screen, otherwise
      click MM
    • Added resetWalkTilePathMM() method to allow scripters to reset the current
      variable used by walkTilePathMM when starting to walk a path. This helps
      prevent hangs.
    • Fixed atMenu() so it will left click if the requested action is the first
      one in the menu (i.e. the default). Enabled other related methods to
      accept a null action, which will perform a left-click on the target’s default
      action.
    • Simlified numerous methods now that atMenu() behaves in a sane and useful
      way.

  • Randoms

    • Added all random scripts from .org

  • GUI

    • Picked up action bar restructuring from .org
      A lot of the “additions” have been taken from RSBot, so without access to their additions your project probably won’t be able to keep up. Even if your users stick to your bot, you probably won’t be able to match the quality.

Read full topic

item.title: Peecs RSBot
item.dc:creator: @zzSLeepzz zzSLeepzz
item.description:
@zzSLeepzz wrote:

Why don’t we get back to the real crux of the problem that led to all this foolishness? Maybe we can do it without all the personal attacks? Maybe?

Granted, I agree that the advertisement was really unnecessary and over the top. It’s kinda like .org’s “marketing” of VIP status and the supposed VIP scripts that you gain access to. Those scripts aren’t really anything to write home about. The best scripts are the ones that are simply advertised to all for a fee.

The real root of the problem is the java code that surrounds rs.jar. It certainly can do with a great deal of improvement. Improvements geared toward making script writing less of an exercise in the minute details of randomization, mouse movements and clicking. Improvements to how randomization is done (flat distributions…give me a break). Improvements in detecting the cursor moving over the menu hotspot in a target tile. Improvements in continually varying mouse speed and reaction time rather than having a fixed one or one that is set only once when a script starts.

Mods and admins whine and complain about leechers and when people come along (yes, just like me) that attempt to make an honest effort, they get snubbed. “We need more randomization!” Ha! As if that will throw Jagex off. Hyper-randomization is completely un-human-like. You want the bot to be detectable, it has to act just like a human. But noone cares to listen.

Any effort that is going to improve on RSBot necessarily must be based on RSBot. It is an excellent base to start from because it is an excellent bot…but not excellent enough. But if the proprietors of the base aren’t interested in new contributors, what are we to do? Sure, maintain our own private version. But I want to share my particular efforts with others, and yes, even RSBot itself it they wanted.

All of this division and personal attacking is a waste of energy and really unnecessary. It’s very unfortunate that it has come to this. I for one, LOVE the challenge of making a bot that Jagex can’t catch. That’s my goal. You guys want to have a pissing contest, have at it.

Read full topic

[quote=“Pker, post:14, topic:268129”][quote author=qauters link=topic=353909.msg2711946#msg2711946 date=1237376964]
If I see an other advertisement on MITB, I’ll change the license of rs.jar to not be allowed to use for forks.
Including built in protection, you are warned.
[/quote]

Qauters.

#1 . WHY do you have so much against rsbot [DOT] info ? Because they are better?
#2 . Does it matter if you change your very own little license ? No. You have no jurisdiction on the rs.jar file! Its Jagex’s LTD property , not Qauters very own property because you insert some methods! So your file will pretty much always be copied - even thought you got your very own little license in your nut.[/quote]
Perhaps the reason why he has so much against the site is because they are advertising where they shouldn’t be, and are being annoying. Also, if he inserts the methods, his modified version belongs to him, and he legally has the right to rape you. Up the butt.
I wonder what will happen to the site…
